TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE Novgorod . She is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer with ORG in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by Mr P. Laptev , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the applicant bought a flat on FAC from PERSON . for CARDINAL non - denominated NORP roubles ( “ RUR ” ) . On DATE . acquired for himself a new flat on FAC .
On DATE Zh . sued the applicant , seeking to have declared the sale of the FAC flat void ab initio .
On DATE the applicant brought a counterclaim for clear title in the FAC flat and Zh . ’s eviction from it . She asked for an injunction on all transactions with the FAC flat .

On DATE the ORG of PERSON issued an interim decision imposing a charging order in respect of the DATE Boulevard flat and prohibiting notaries public and the ORG registration authorities from registering any transactions with the flat .

On DATE Zh . sold the DATE Boulevard flat to a third party . On DATE ORG of ORG of PERSON ( Управление регистрации и технической инвентаризации ORG по управлению городским имуществом PERSON г. PERSON , “ the Registration Directorate ” ) registered the sale .
On DATE the applicant asked ORG to declare the registration null and void .

On DATE a deputy head of ORG responded that the registration had been “ erroneous ” and that the person responsible had been disciplined . He advised the applicant to apply to a court for a declaration of nullity of the transaction and for compensation for the pecuniary damage .

On DATE the ORG of PERSON found for Zh . It held that the sale of the FAC flat had been void ab initio . Zh . retained title to that flat but was ordered to repay the purchase price to the applicant . The applicant ’s counterclaim was dismissed .
On DATE the applicant instituted enforcement proceedings . As PERSON . had little money and no assets , the amount due to her was not recovered in full until DATE .

On DATE the applicant sued in tort the ORG agency for registration of rights to , and transactions with , immovable property of ORG ( Государственное учреждение юстиции PERSON области по регистрации прав на недвижимое имущество и сделок с ним , “ the Registration Agency ” ) . She sought compensation for the pecuniary damage incurred through the unlawful registration carried out by ORG on DATE .

On DATE the ORG of PERSON gave judgment . It found that Zh . was responsible for the fact that the applicant had not received in good time the amount due to her under the judgment of DATE . Moreover , although the applicant had become aware of the sale of the FAC flat long before the judgment of CARDINAL DATE was issued , she had not sought alternative interim measures . Hence , ORG was not liable for the damage incurred by the applicant through Zh . ’s persistent failure to repay the purchase price .
On DATE the ORG upheld the judgment , relying on the following grounds :

“ As the charging order in respect of Zh . ’s flat on FAC was issued on DATE , whereas Zh . sold the flat on DATE , at the moment of the sale the charging order had not yet become effective ( the time - limit for lodging an appeal had not expired ) and therefore Zh . could sell the flat ; moreover , the court rightly found that at the moment of the sale [ of the flat ] the judgment debt had not yet arisen . The judgment was given on CARDINAL DATE , but only became effective in DATE .

Between the date the judgment became effective and the date the enforcement began LOC . could dispose of the contested flat . Thus , it appears from the case file , even before Zh . ’s claim was granted , [ the applicant ] had become aware of the sale of the flat but had failed to undertake any measures . ”
ORG confirmed the findings of ORG as to the absence of the fault on the part of ORG .

Article CARDINAL of the RSFSR Code of Civil Procedure of DATE ( effective until DATE ) provided that a judge could order an interim measure at the request of a party or of his own initiative . Interim measures may include , in particular , a charging order in respect of the defendant ’s property ( Article CARDINAL ) .

An interim measure was to be implemented immediately in accordance with the procedure set out for enforcement of judgments ( Article CARDINAL ) . An appeal lay against the decision indicating an interim measure ; the lodging of an appeal did not suspend the implementation of the measure ( Article CARDINAL ) .

A ORG agency or a ORG official shall be liable to a citizen for damage caused by their unlawful actions or failures to act . Such damage is to be compensated for at the expense of the federal or regional treasury ( Article CARDINAL of LAW of GPE ) .
